column4: How do I add new repositories to Ubuntu Software Center? I am getting an error when I try to download php5. ¨Failed to fetch ¨
why are you adding a repository to install php?
ok, let's start at the ROOT problem then. what was the first issue you had (ex: need php)
how did you try installing mediawiki?
software center, apt-get, manual, etc
ok, and what *exact* error did you get when trying to do that
have you installed any PPA's?
PPA = 3rd party repository
don't do it, I just want to make sure you haven't already (they cause a LOT of problems sometimes)
please follow these instructions and let us know if your encounter any errors: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MediaWiki
Ill follow instructions. Then Ill report to you soon.
you are soo active here =O
I have been lately :)
I do a lot of ubuntu work (I'm also a brainstorm moderator). I used the irc a lot when I was starting out, so this is my way of paying it back :)
did you get mediawiki working?
it is still downloading... :(
ok
is this a new ubuntu installation?
if you don't have much installed already, it may be a good idea to reinstall to undo what-ever the .bin installer did
well 12.04 is an LTS release which is good, if you want *super* stable, try the previous LTS (10.04)
you maen 32 vs 64 bit?
oh. I don't know anythong about the cloud version, sorry. But I have used the server version with great success
thanks using that guide I could make it work.
good to hear
